intro: Spuriopimpinella brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and narrow, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Spuriopimpinella brachycarpa is an annual or biennial species, often found in the western United States.
